title: Strategies for Enhancing Mathematics Classroom Learning Through Collaborative Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic math concepts and high school-level math learning experience
context.additional_context: Students engage in collaborative learning projects using digital devices, experiencing iterative feedback processes applying quality control concepts

learning_goals: Students can structure mathematical problem-solving processes in three or more collaborative projects and explain them with over 80% accuracy.
Learners can iteratively improve the quality of project deliverables at least three times using a peer assessment system.

By dividing roles among team members, learners can write and share peer feedback on mathematical reasoning processes five or more times, achieving over 4 points (on a 5-point scale) in the final evaluation.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
